climbs.name: unknown route
climbs.fa: ? i'd be curious to know the history ?

content.description: Locate the obvious crack splitting most of the top of the slab. Start up the slab until the first bolt about 20 ft. up. You can go right or left to get there. This first part is not to hard but a little tenuous and unprotected, so be careful. Climb past 2 old buttonheads and a horizontal and then take the crack to the grassy topout. Plenty of lichen adds the "+" to my rating.
content.protection: 2 buttonhead bolts, chocks and cams .3-#2. You can run back 50 ft to sling a boulder (bring some long webbing for this) to bring up your second.
content.location: Head past the mint hut over a small hill toward the creek you would fill your water at. Look to your left and you will see the slabÂ

content.description: If you happen to have packed a rack back to the mint hut and have some down time there is a fun slab just past the hut and shurely some other climbing to be had in the area.
